issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.summary: Error returned when some other type is read as string from parquet tables

ATTACHMENT ID: 12905520 - PreCommit-HIVE-Build

[~ashutoshc], [~alangates], [~owen.omalley], [~sershe]: If a column type is changed into String, VarChar or Char, query on the table gives runtime error on Parquet tables.  With this fix, it will return the actual value if the original type was TimeStamp, Decimal, Double, Float, BigInt, Int, SmallInt, Tinyint or Boolean.  Please let me know if you see any issues with the fix.

One question that may have gone unnoticed on the RB: do we need to handle all the others types like date, interval, or any of the complex types like array, struct, union, etc.

[~stakiar]: You probably missed my response in the RB:  The simple types that are common between Impala and hive just for string types is handled by this fix. More type related fixes will be coming in the future.
[~janulatha] thanks for the clarification. I still don't see your response in the RB? Maybe you forgot to publish your response?
Thanks [~stakiar].  :) It wasn't published.
